verses.roman:
avidūre vraja-bhuvaḥ
saha gopāla-dārakaiḥ
cārayām āsatur vatsān
nānā-krīḍā-paricchadau

synonyms: avidūre—not very far from the residential quarters of the Vrajavāsīs; vraja-bhuvaḥ—from the land known as Vraja; saha gopāla-dārakaiḥ—with other boys of the same profession (cowherd boys); cārayām āsatuḥ—tended; vatsān—the small calves; nānā—various; krīḍā—sporting; paricchadau—dressed very nicely in different ways and equipped with implements.
translation: Not far away from Their residential quarters, both Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, equipped with all kinds of playthings, played with other cowherd boys and began to tend the small calves.
